subject: Class Not Found Error from a Command Line
msgSnippet: This is a common question, but just the same I can t see the trouble. On Windows with junit 4.1, I create a .bat file like so: set JARS=. bin set

This is a common question, but just the same I can't see the trouble.

On W=
indows with junit 4.1, I create a .bat file like so:

set JARS=3D.\bin
set =
JARS=3D%JARS%;..\somedir\lib\junit.jar

java -cp %JARS% org.junit.runner.JU=
nitCore com.something.test.SomeTest

I run this .bat file one directory up =
from bin.  The test class file is here, relative to the current directory:
=

bin\com\something\test\SomeTest.class

junit tells me "Can not find class:=
 com.something.test.SomeTest"

The format of the test is old (extends TestC=
ase), but I don't think it finding the class at all.  Interestingly, if I j=
ust run this:

java -cp %JARS% com.something.test.SomeTest

It says can't f=
ind main, which would seem to indicate that it is finding the class file.  =


What could be wrong?  I have used "dir" commands in the .bat file to make=
 sure everything is where I think it is.

Thanks
